channel.title: SciML Book
channel.description: This book is a compilation of lecture notes from the MIT Course 18.337J/6.338J: Parallel Computing and Scientific Machine Learning. Links to the old notes https://mitmath.github.io/18337 will redirect here.

item.title: The Different Flavors of Parallelism
item.description: Now that you are aware of the basics of parallel computing, let's give a high level overview of the differences between different modes of parallelism.

item.title: Homework 1
item.description: Homework 1

item.title: From Optimization to Probabilistic Programming
item.description: From Optimization to Probabilistic Programming

item.title: The Basics of Single Node Parallel Computing
item.description: The answer to the 'end of Moore's Law' is Parallel Computing. However, programs need to be specifically designed in order to adequately use parallelism. This lecture will describe at a very high level the forms of parallelism and when they are appropriate.

item.title: Differentiable Programming and Neural Differential Equations
item.description: Differentiable Programming and Neural Differential Equations

item.title: Mixing Differential Equations and Neural Networks for Physics-Informed Learning
item.description: Mixing Differential Equations and Neural Networks for Physics-Informed Learning

item.title: Introduction to Scientific Machine Learning through Physics-Informed Neural Networks
item.description: Here we will start to dig into what scientific machine learning is all about by looking at physics-informed neural networks.

item.title: Ordinary Differential Equations, Applications and Discretizations
item.description: In this discussion we will understand how to numerically compute ordinary differential equations by transforming them into discrete dynamical systems, and use this to come up with simulation techniques for physical systems.

item.title: Introduction to MPI.jl
item.description: Description of MPI and MPI.jl, including demonstrations on its use.

item.title: Global Sensitivity Analysis
item.description: Global Sensitivity Analysis

item.title: GPU programming
item.description: Levels of parallelism in hardware

item.title: Parallel Computing and Scientific Machine Learning (SciML): Methods and Applications
item.description: Parallel Computing and Scientific Machine Learning (SciML): Methods and Applications, MIT Course 18.337J/6.338J. Includes physics-informed learning, scientific machine learning, science-guided AI, neural differential equations, and more.

item.title: Forward-Mode Automatic Differentiation (AD) via High Dimensional Algebras
item.description: Forward-Mode Automatic Differentiation (AD) via High Dimensional Algebras

item.title: Code Profiling and Optimization
item.description: Code Profiling and Optimization

item.title: How Loops Work, An Introduction to Discrete Dynamics
item.description: In this lecture we will go over the basic properties of dynamical systems and understand their general behavior through code.

item.title: Basic Parameter Estimation, Reverse-Mode AD, and Inverse Problems
item.description: Have a model. Have data. Fit model to data.

item.title: Solving Stiff Ordinary Differential Equations
item.description: Let's now go down the path of understanding how to efficiently implement stiff ordinary differential equation solvers, and its interaction with other domains like automatic differentiation.

item.title: PDEs, Convolutions, and the Mathematics of Locality
item.description: PDEs, Convolutions, and the Mathematics of Locality

item.title: Uncertainty Programming, Generalized Uncertainty Quantification
item.description: Uncertainty Programming, Generalized Uncertainty Quantification

item.title: Optimizing Serial Code
item.description: This discussion of serial code optimization will directly motivate why we will be using Julia throughout this course.
